Bm5-IbAG46oiewdCizpTrQ.text: 4* for the food but the location itself for Al fresco dining on a sunny, balmy evening is literally overshadowed by a pub and ransoms wandering past.Yes it's super central and yes the food is reliable but it lacked that certain something my boyfriend and I look for in a top london restaurant for date night :)

JJg5ANUy8Viti2g8kVRYeg.text: What an amazing experience!  Chef Luke and Carolina and their whole team made the most delicious experience for my daughters 21st bday!  To finish the Kitchen Table experience with a tour of the Kitchen made my daughters year!  Simply outstanding!

rum7GluE1EZrva3imEqZig.text: Amazing food, absolutely great location and if possible even better service!We were a couple with two boys, after the main course the waitress took the boys upstairs to the ice cream bar, happy back they had a whole bowl full of jelly beans, chocolate bits and more to top up their ice cream.We had good drinks and the ambiance reminded us that this is a city to enjoy wether a family or couple out.When we got the bill they had deducted 15%+ for the kids.We will be back and fortunately we are often in London.

3yXiAznybs8gsI7kDmGxiQ.text: Perfection.  Can you give six stars?Where do I start?  Perfect, attentive, friendly but not snobby service. Wonderfully prepared food. One of those me menus where you would eat anything from it. Wonderful wine on the menu. Not just in the top price bracket. Everything was perfect. We went for a celebration, US Mother's Day eve meal.  Momma was happy. She has great food. A world class salad, where every single ingredient was perfect. I had the rib eye. They have sourced wonderful meat. It is worked perfectly.  Served immediately. And the sides were exceptional.The cheese plate was brilliant.  The kids were kept happy with the ice cream bar. But on no. Such a big day!  My Mrs started nodding off. So from nowhere. Expresso martinis on the house.  I would give seven stars if I could in hindsight.

MdZp-W1q9vDyTBAVhjDXxg.text: We had a great night there. The service and the food was great. Good job Gordon!I had the tuna Tatar and the osso buco.

iJGydcg4l7J9tm-ECUTGKA.text: After nearly a week of overdone beef and boring pub pies, we were skipping meals.  The London fries are great, but we were looking for fresh vegetables and found tiny wilted salads, and mostly potatoes and curries.  Then we stumbled upon this restaurant.  Gordon Ramsay was our savior.  His restaurant provides the fresh, quality ingredients we had been missing!  Had a wonderful experience from start (took us without a reservation) to finish (satisfied all of our gastronomic desires!).  Fresh, creative salads, beef cooked to perfection, made-to-order juices, and the dessert to die for.  Now we are on the hunt for more of these London gems!  (Nothing against great curries and British fries, but you can only eat so many and we just missed California fresh foods!)

photos.caption: Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Chocolate fondant - again the best so far!
Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Fillet - we all agreed it was the best we've ever had
Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Lobster dish

CPGoXkK_7La3w6fHJhnCfA.text: The restaurant has a great vibe and location but the rest of it missed the mark.  Service was poor, and the chicken wings and Mac-n-cheese were both average.

WzLq59JprvsIPEold06yQw.text: Food was WAY overpriced and the service was dreadful. Does not feel like a Gordon Ramsay restaurant at all. We got blown off for a larger table and were stuck waiting for 45 minutes for the bill, and we still had to pay the service charge. Went and had to complain to the management and will not dine here again.

SOmkFR8ApJWgPqTxpRsfNA.text: Outstanding place. Great atmosphere and vibe and fabulous food.  Wings, mussels and tuna tartar amazing.  All mains the five of us got were great and the desserts off the charts.  Will come back on next visit.

yx_M81xvm172dKvGnhUEDg.text: Y'all were good.  Not great, but good.  Had the chateaubriand with the husbter and we devoured it.  Kiddies loved the novel ice cream bar.  The night we were there an exceedingly large group of tourists were seated next to us...around 50 customers all along the window wall upstairs....our service rapidly diminished after their arrival.  Not what I would expect from a celebrity-chef led restaurant...service seems to always let me down at GR restaurants.  Pity.

JMpGmz_vXSJaEAeGyHxc9g.text: Exelent breakfast. The Sunday Roast beef is 10 of 10. The staff are really professional. The desert was to small for the price. I will definitely go back with friends, family and colleagues...

photos.caption: Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Don't forget the vinelist...
Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Simple concept with a simple but top class menu.
Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Tasteful tea.

U01P0rFIDeW0B_19js4bHA.text: I had breakfast here a few weeks ago before work. Its like Gordon's other places around- Bread Street Kitchen, same kind of interior and menu's are very similar. I arrived a bit earlier then my friend, and was offered toast whilst I waited. Big thumbs up for this. Everyone loves a bit of jam of buttery toast whilst they wait. I ordered the avocado on pumpernickel bread, and it was uber delicious. Could be the aussie in my that loves avocado and eggs for breakfast, but it was very delicious.There is nothing I could fault for my breakfast, it was fast service, delicious meals, and great value for money, and best of all opened from 7:30am so its the perfect place to have a before work catchup.

HmnirQuh7P3KDFNI3FqG9w.text: HSK part of the Ramsay group, replaced The Living Room. Went for Sunday brunch, nice atmosphere when arriving and looked like a busy morning so good signs at first. Seated with our backs the the entrance so got a cold draft every time people came in or left despite there being double doors.  Could have done with one of those blankets but guess that's for those alfresco dinners out side!  Service was slow, took a good 5-10mins after being seated before waiter asked for drinks and another 5 to order out food. Went for bottomless brew, at no point were we offered a top up.  Brew was pretty average, but at least was hot upon arrival.  Ordered the build your own breakfast and the sweet corn frittata.  Was good portions and but was pretty average.  The scrambled eggs were defiantly not up to Gordon's usual standard not smooth silky and creamy.  Took a fair while to get the bill too.   Was just 'ok' to be honest.

photos.caption: Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. HSK build your own breakfast
Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Sweet corn frittata

VbWZhkXEJ4kuuP02Zis6Tg.text: One of the best highlights in London!  If Gordon Ramsay is a food god then it all makes sense!  This place awesome!

X2K-Z7xqbQ-2GufDSXFuFA.text: I'd been wanting to try one of Gordon Ramsey's restaurants for a while now and this place did not disappoint! I was well satisfied by both the food and service. For starters, I got to try the cured salmon with yuzu avocado puree and the baked scallop - both dishes had wonderful (but different) tastes, but I definitely liked the scallop more. The salmon was a bit lighter while the scallop had a stronger feel (especially because of the bacon).For the main course I went for the steamed sea bream, which I also really enjoyed! The fish was cooked perfectly and had an amazingly soft (yet not mushy) texture. With the clams, sauce, and the sprouting broccoli, I thought the dish was extremely well balanced - although the broccoli was a bit overcooked in my opinion, as I would've preferred a harder texture.And the dessert...my friend and I, who are major fans of dessert, decided to go for the chef's selection plate, which came with four items: eton mess, dark chocolate tart, pineapple and melon carpaccio, and the baked New York cheesecake. Unfortunately, I only really liked the cheesecake. I wasn't a fan of the eton mess (mostly because I'm not a fan of merengue), the dark chocolate was too dense for me, and the pineapple and melon carpaccio just didn't appeal to my taste buds (probably because when it comes to dessert I don't really prefer fruity things). However, the cheesecake was REALLY GOOD - probably one of the best cheesecakes I've ever had.Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed my meal here. The service was great too, and our waitress was super sweet. My only real complaint is for the dessert chef's selection plate, which I felt was underwhelming especially compared to the starters and main course. If you want dessert, I'd definitely suggest getting the cheesecake over the other three I tried! Or maybe the chocolate fondant...which I'll definitely be trying the next time I visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Mad Hatter's Tea Party Dessert Cocktail
Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Roasted cod
Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Kale, red cabbage, pumpkin and sunflower seed salad

MCnCxC14-nDyYb9uinVlNQ.text: I went for a post theatre menu to Heddon's. We all ordered medium rare steak which came with mass potatoes. I really didn't like the quality of the meat. It didn't taste well. The mash potatoes weren't creamy or that tasty. The next day three people for the group that ordered the steak had upset stomachs in various degree of pain. I wouldn't eat here again. The service was good and the staff was friendly. The restaurant itself has a nice vibe.

wveTECBgDOG1SlHCH9w4FQ.text: I had dinner a couple months after they opened. My expectations were definite exceeded as far as food goes. The decor is fantastic, they knocked it out of the park design wise. The plate and silverware have a nice eclectic look and feel.The service was a bit rough. I somehow thought the same intolerance for poor cuisine would translate over to the front of the house delivery. Our server had very little knowledge of the food and its preparation. Even less informed about the wine list. How unfortunate that this basic level of training was severely overlooked.I only rated this 4 stars because the meal was outstanding. I hope they resolve the service issues. I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Crab legs and salad
Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Lemon tart

eMS4KCQKGSpCy9Aa-4Oe8Q.text: What a great place to go. A nice restaurant with great food. The whole time we've been in London we've had to get used to the wait staff. (Usually not as attentive as America) but here the service was great. Every time I needed something the waitress was there. No need to go in depth about the food. It was amazing. You can't go wrong with anything!

photos.caption: Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Sticky toffee pudding at top and caramel chocolate mousse on bottom. Both winners!
Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. It's all just so good! The pork knuckle croquettes we're fabulous

5uauKtuziBv0vpfoqRYZaQ.text: Amazing place with a relaxed atmosphere and the food is out of this world the duck I had was cooked to perfection and the Brussel sprout bacon mix was fab.  I will return for sure in the future as this is now one of my best places to eat in London

T5D2v75BbuUlZO9uqpJRHg.text: Great Brunch option, just off Regent Street - Me, the Better half and my big Sister decided on here for Brunch - and I have to say it was a great choice, we started with three brunch cocktails, all where delicious and a great start to the day! Between the three of us we had a traditional cooked breakfast, eggs Benedict and avocado and poached eggs on pumpernickel bread - all where extremely tasty fresh and poached eggs where absolute perfection.Service was warm and polished and we all left very happy!I'd return or recommend in a heartbeat!

photos.caption: Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

gx70bd-xLMlWMNBv6uIb5g.text: Decent dinner spot. Friendly customer service, good meat based dishes. Vegeterian friend was not extremely impressed. Tuna tartare could be spicier, but the beef cheeks were well done. The designated driver drinks were very flavorful, liked spring sensation a lot, a bit on the sour side. Got too full for a dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Mac and cheese
Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Beef cheeks
Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Spicy tuna tartare

1sVg2j1BxdiaQoyGoNAiIg.text: I wish to convey in few words my profound enjoyment of the Beef Wellington, this establishment's signature dish. The perfect arrangement of flavours, meticulously swirled oil paints upon the blank canvas of your tongue. An experience I could only describe as a waltz in your mouth, the sheer tenderness of the Beef  dancing in a flowing dress of red wine upon the dancefloor of portobello. The crispy flakes keep you on your toes until they melt away into song, a medley that never becomes bland. A burst of aromatic cherry tomato cleanses the palate, renewing your vigor bite after bite. As the dish nears it's end, like Cinderella in the ballroom approaching midnight the Magic will fade from your palate, a memory on your lips, the long 45 minute wait a reminder of the toils endured to step into those glass heels. I highly recommend.The Scampi was pretty good, but found the chicken skewers lacking substance.

XJuOyBJKGBnkmEILMchmpQ.text: Decided to go here because we were interested to see if Gordon Ramsey's standards of food translated from his TV shows to real life. We were not disappointed. Lovely decor, nice outdoor seating as well, had a reservation and sat right away. We started with the scallops, which were everything that you could imagine and more. Perfectly cooked and very flavorful. We then shared the beef Wellington and truffle mashed potato. The menu says that the beef is a 45 minute wait, and they were pretty accurate on the timing. WOW!! Your knife cuts like butter through the meat, perfectly cooked and delicious. You don't even need the sauce that accompanies it. The truffle mash was a little strong and first, but very good. Would highly recommend and will be back when I'm in the area again.

photos.caption: Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

pqg4OtjY5H9XRaljWafavw.text: Had to do the Gordon Ramsay experience, so we tried this for a late breakfast. The little street it is tucked away in is absolutely adorable and away from the bustle of Regent Street. A great venue with outdoor seating if you prefer, and inside, it's swanky as ever. I can imagine it being a great place to have an evening drink, along with dinner. The staff are superb, quick, and kind. The full english is lean and rather light--in a good way--for what it is. The tea china is beautiful and matching, and come on, that's mostly why it's so fun to order tea at a restaurant (for me at least). The porridge was just meh. Perhaps I was expecting something a little more flashy and garnished, but I suppose that's what I get for breaking the cardinal rule of never ordering porridge at a restaurant, when I could go home and throw some plain oats and boiling water in a sauce pan, serve up, and eat as it is. Nonetheless, would definitely return for a second more substantial meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Cool water bottles
Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Fantastically beautiful china!
Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. meh porridge.

aa9PpnComc-R9y-eskGyMA.text: Food, of course, was delicious. Atmosphere was quaint and peaceful. But, the service was just ok. It took the waitress about 5 minutes just to come back with a menu. In fact, it wasn't even my waitress that did that...it was maybe a manager who was walking by and saw there were no menus. Even, to get the check...I had to walk up to a completely different waitress. I've been to several different Gordon Ramsey restaurants...and, I've always had impeccable service. I was looking forward to my London experience...and, I was a little disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips with mashed peas

XYuLCSn45tGkgz94pDlZug.text: We have visited this restaurant three times. We recently dined here for lunch. It was a fantastic experience. My husband ordered the lamb shank and it was outstanding. The meat was very moist and perfectly done. I had the sea bass and it was delicious. We were given a tour of the kitchen by Daniele. He was extremely attentive and provided excellent service. We also met Neo the head chef. This is a man that loves his job and takes extreme pride in this restaurant and the quality of the food. There are so many choices in London that it is hard to decide where to eat. I would highly recommend this establishment and will return again when we get back to London.

xbiuDc-foQrhnJRNsMXjKw.text: Me and some friends booked a table for brunch here and had planned to use 2-4-1 vouchers through Emerald Street. When we got there, we were given a separate menu made up of just 3 items; muesli, egg & bacon roll, and scrambled egg with salmon. If any of us had been a vegetarian, we'd have been stuck with a measly bowl of muesli. (I've just checked their site and it looks like they've changed the Emerald Street menu, but the deal ends today, so a little too late). As it was cold and wet outside, we decided to stay where we were and just order from the main menu. This meant we couldn't use our vouchers and would have to pay full price for everything we ordered. 2 of our party went for the full English breakfast which didn't look to filling at all, with only 1 sausage, 2 pieces of bacon, 1 big mushroom, 2 tiny (and overdone) poached eggs and a tomato. There wasn't even any toast! This plate is priced at £11.50, and if you wanted an ungenerous extra side of baked beans, it would set you back £3! Another of our party ordered the avocado on pumpernickel toast, which was very much burnt. The service wasn't too great either. Our waitress came over to ask why we hadn't paid the service charger, and after giving her out reasons, she practically rolled her eyes at us. Safe to say we shan't be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Scrambled egg on toast with a side of avocado. Quite nice, but nothing special.
Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Looks may be deceiving. Pretty cups, but poor quality food for the price you pay.

Jbx2zJR22SFpUgz8ndAjhg.text: Ice cream bar upstairs was cool. Otherwise good all around experience in a great location.

photos.caption: Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Choose your own ice cream desert bar upstairs

iqKCK73MvVvJUWqO5yXgYQ.text: I was really impressed by this place, I'll admit I hadn't previously come here because it's opposite Strawberry Moon, which I don't have a high regard for, but I'm glad we tried this place out. Nice interior and really nice brunch options. The pastries were delicious and very fresh tasting. I wasn't a fan of the crumpets although I appreciated they were trying to revamp the traditional one. The sweet corn frittata was definitely a favourite. I'm sure I'll come here again.

j9o6gRutVqes0KgYUod02A.text: After watching Gordon Ramsey for years, finally had the chance to dine in one of restaurants in London. After reviewing the choices, we made a reservation at HSK. The location is in a very cool part of Piccadilly and the decor is cool. As one of his more casual restaurants, no dress code but as it was a Friday night, we spiffed up. Was seated right away upstairs facing the courtyard (it faces a small private street with other restaurants). That is where the issues started. After being seated, it took quite a while for drinks to be delivered. We are talking about a bottle of wine and water. From that point on, we had to ask for water. Mind you, the table next to us had water glasses refilled many times without asking. For example, I flagged down a server and asked for water. The server returned to the table next to us, looked over at our empty glasses and filled their water. That's it. End of story. One of Gordon's trademarks is hot food. Always make sure the whole table is served. My sirloin was lukewarm at best. It took several minutes to get anyone's attention to ask for it to be reheated. By time a new one was brought to me my whole party had finished. Out of 4 dishes, the best compliment was for the Mac & cheese, does that say something? Not once did anyone check on us throughout the visit if not flagged down by us. In shows like Kitchen Nightmares, Chef Ramsey preaches customer satisfaction is most important. Sadly, my party and I did not get that attention. The food would have been better if the experience was better.

hdI05Zu6GElvbccmvH7FvA.text: I went to Heddon Street for a pricey Christmas lunch.  I was not disappointed the food and service was excellent. Wine loved (now I wish i could remember what it was). The only minus is  i felt rushed by the server, but that will not stop me from returning to try more tasty dishes. It is money well spent.

photos.caption: Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Appetizers

hYDLM-ZnXCWj98zNWyaYOQ.text: What do you want me to say? This place is just perfect. Very cozy and clean, nice outside seating too, friendly staff and great food. Don't you ever walk by without having lunch or dinner here.

SlnrNphMAwc8wGJgy-Jzxw.text: This was a successful last minute Yelp search. It was our first night in London so was looking for traditional British food. My wife mentioned Beef Wellington and I was on a mission. Overall the food experience was good but the place lacked some basic details to make it great. Would rate 4 or higher if a little more value and waitress had more menu knowledge.Upon first walking in at around 6:30-7pm it was a little quiet but nice atmosphere. We were quickly addressed at the host bar and taken to our seats. We did not have reservations so they took us to a less desirable spot that had a burnt out light near a waiter hub. At first I was really annoyed as there were plenty of open seats in better spots but after 15 minutes the place really filled up.  As in many places, make reservations in advance.The waitress was quick to visit, a little dry and quick to offer bottled water, tap water is good in London. She also offered bread and olives, I knew from previous dining experiences this would be at cost, so heads up. The bread and olives were great though.They had a decent drinks list and I had the "More Than Illegal" cocktail a sweet bourbon based drink with banana flavours. It tasted great if not a bit thick because of the banana purée. I was disappointed when I asked the waitress what one of the contents was and she didn't know and didn't really make an effort to inform herself. In the end, didn't want to make a deal so ordered anyways, good choice though.For the meal I ordered beef Wellington... curse my wife's lack of hunger! She only wanted a salad and the beef Wellington could only be ordered for 2. My 1st world dreams (for the evening) were dashed. I ordered the 8oz filet which was very good! My wife's beetroot salad was awesome and would have worked great as a side to the steak.The overall cost seems high for the decor level but the food quality is very good. Want to dine here again, except when my wife is hungry to order the Beef Wellington.

photos.caption: Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

n9PL_y2pO-i7MtNY1C7_DA.text: There is a youtube video by GR where he cooks a beef wellington for Christmas and it's where I realized that I could cook really high quality meals at home. When I found out that I could have Gordon's version, we had to do it. We arrived early because we also had the Cocktail Masterclass (another hobby) and wanted to allot plenty of time. While the wellington was top notch, the masterclass sticks out as a highlight of our entire trip. Georgi (head bartender?) is easily the person I remember most of any meal I had while visiting London. He went above and beyond anything I've ever experienced at a restaurant and made the night/trip for us. We had an incredible time at Heddon St and honestly it blew away our meal at Petrus (or anywhere else). Nothing against Petrus, but that's how special the service from Georgi and team was. His knowledge of cocktails and crafting them to fit specific tastes is second to none. He spent nearly 30 minutes getting to know my wife and I and crafting two unique cocktails to suit our tastes. After we finished the cocktail class and headed to our table, he came over a few more times to check on us and make sure everything was perfect. You couldn't ask for a better date night than a cocktail masterclass at Heddon St with Georgi followed by an incredible meal.

a76qGEeYoNz1uIAtBSCHtw.text: I have a special place in my favorite restaurants for Bread Street Kitchen, so while I really enjoyed Heddon Street, Bread Street is still my favorite. And, yes, I know the menus are basically the same. I love the decor and the simplistic menu. It has the basic brunch listed (e.g. eggs benny), but it also has some different brunch items. Try the fresh juices, if you don't feel like drinking. Service was great, and the atmosphere was awesome. I just wish I had gotten to the ice cream bar upstairs!

ZVh12xUjP9TwQ43xN0ymBw.text: We were visiting from Hawaii and wanted to try a Gordon Ramsay restaurant. Decided on this one and it was truly a good choice. Service was great and so was the food. We ended up getting the scallop appetizer, Caesar salad, and olives. For the main course, we tried the Beef Wellington with truffle mashed potatoes. The potatoes were SO tasty! The beef Wellington was also delicious. A lot of food for two!

photos.caption: Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

OtxsnctJK7nIWsR12yEyqg.text: ehhhh it felt like eating at TGI Fridays or some other chain. Service was super pushy/rushed and food was just okay, nothing special. Mushroom flatbread had puréed mushrooms, and just didn't look or taste very good. We asked for no pancetta on the Caesar salad and it came with it anyway. Seems like a pretty simple request... speaking of the Caesar salad, we also had to ask for pepper to add to the bland dressing. For entrees, we had the cod and sea bass. Both were decent, but came with the skin still on, which Gordon always tells people not to do unless it's crisp.  Also they charge £3.50 for four pieces of bread and a pat of butter. For the money, you can definitely do better in the area.

abvA-k4j8SyinDsFGEpxBA.text: Was looking for a place to have a traditional Sunday dinner last Sunday with my wife and daughter on our first day in London. We ordered a nice bottle of wine and the Sunday dinner and my daughter the burger. The server suggested some sizzling greens as a nice add on. The Bordeaux was great. The dinner came with the same sizzling greens that I ordered extra along with some veggies and Yorkshire pudding. The pudding and the gravy was bland and seemed made separate from any juices from the roast. The burger was tasty and I would stick to the bar fare if dining here.

l_mPgOuzF_5x4TtRmiDgug.text: 10 yards off regents street, this restaurant is hidden in very pretty and cozy square with a very nice outdoor patio. Their service was very professional, quick, and accurate. The food quality is above average. Excellent for couples, groups, even business outing.

photos.caption: Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Menu
Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Menu
Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Dining

OF5IQKiAH7PENum-G6oFtg.text: What a fabulous place this is for families with babies, and young children.  A restaurant that welcomes children that is not in the fast food category.  They even have a special offer during January, kids under 12 eat for free, one child per an adult dining on the a la carte menu.  And a babies changing room.However, it is let down by its food.  I really have tasted better and expected better for a Gordon Ramsey restaurant.  It really is very hit and miss. Some dishes were nice and some were just hard to eat. We had the set menu as this seems good value at £26 for three courses (but with the Time Out offer you also get a dessert cocktail).  A choice between the Rillettes of Scottish Salmon, avocado and watercress or Mushroom and Parmesan soup for starters.  I chose the former and my partner chose the latter.  I wish I chose the latter now, as the soup was really creamy and tasty, whereas the salmon was disappointingly plain and tasteless. On to the mains, I chose the wood oven roasted trout with buttered leeks and my partner chose the slow braised British beef, parsley and garlic.  Again, he chose the better dish.  The braised beef was lovely and tender. I could hardly eat my buttered leeks as they were so salty. Even eating it with the bland tasting trout could not take away the saltiness. Perhaps, they put double salt in error.  Then on to the dessert.  Finally, I chose well.  I had the mulled wine meringue, which consisted of a mulled wine sorbet with a mess of meringue and cream, which went really well together. My partner had the caramel chocolate mousse, which arrived in a little pot with a lid, which he mistook for a sugar bowl.  On opening the lid, there were small broken pieces of shortbread biscuits, no sign of the chocolate mousse.  Digging deep into the little pot only brings up very sweet caramel. Service was a little lax.  We also had to ask for our dessert cocktail and they had to keep checking the offer as they did not know/remember what we had booked,  whether it was the two or the three courses, with or without dessert cocktail.The cocktails were nice enough though, and the restaurant has a relaxed and friendly feel.  However, we left feeling underwhelmed by the whole experience, as even with the offer, the bill came to over £83.  For that price, we could have eaten much better and more interesting elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Mulled Wine Meringue
Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Little pot containing the caramel chocolate mousse
Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Caramel chocolate mousse

U-qNbGTFzgnhZPfsMmn_hQ.text: One of the most disappointing meals I had in London! I had high hopes for one of Gordon Ramsay's restaurants, as I'm a huge admirer of his work. It was my first time dining at one of his establishments and it might be my last. For someone who constantly criticizes others, you would think that he'd make sure his food was above the rest.As far as the ambiance and service, everything was fine in that regard. Waiters and hosts were polite and attentive, nothing above and beyond, but adequate for a restaurant of that supposed caliber. The decor was very interesting, a very nice blend of industrial and classic.Unfortunately where all stars are lost in this review was the food. I started with the Roasted Lamb Rump with a side of Roasted Vegetables. There was no semblance of temperature, as the lamb was cold, but the rest of the dish (gem lettuce and onion) was hot and limp and soaking wet in what I can think was the au jus. On top of it being cold, the lamb was tasteless and chewy as leather. And the side of roast veggies were cold, too!I flagged a waiter and had it sent back for the Sunday Roast. And would you imagine, that was cold and tasteless, too! It had hard fat in it, but at least this time it was edible enough and the roast veggies were hot and flavorful. I was starving, so I dealt with it. Thankfully, they did the honorable thing and comped the dish, but if that's what to be expected at Heddon Street or any of GR's restaurants, I'll be eating elsewhere.

GhEWOOsbubJamTADQWnVxg.text: Call me a fan boy that's fine, but when we began to plan our trip to London, there was only one thing I really wanted to do. It wasn't Buckingham Palace, wasn't Piccadilly Circus, all I really wanted was to eat at a Gordon Ramsay restaurant. Like I said, I'm a fan!Booking from home in Toronto, Canada, I began to seek out a Ramsay restaurant and was stumped when I saw he didn't have just a couple of options, he had somewhere around 20 in London alone! I knew price would be a factor so after looking at some different options I ruled out the ££££ options because I knew it just wasn't feasible to do so (which made me a little sad because I know fine dining is where Gordon really shines). But after speaking with some local pals in the UK, comparing some web reviews on Yelp and other sources, I settled on Heddon Street Kitchen for it's more casual atmosphere and "slightly lower" price point.We made an early reso for 5pm and arrived shortly after opening for evening service. It's in a great location on Heddon Street, an alley way style cobblestone side street just away from the hustle and bustle of the main roads. I was so happy I was literally jumping in my skin from the moment I walked in. The look and the feel of this place was rustic and slightly industrial with a polished finish. It was totally in my element.Even being a more casual look and feel the steps of service were still as spot on as if you were at a Michelin star spot. From the hostesses to the servers to the Somm who was sent to our table the moment we decide we might be interested in ordering a bottle of wine with our meal.We began with a pair of cocktails, I opted for one of the "before meal" cocktails named - From a Few to a Thrill which had Campari, Martini Rosso, Grapefruit bitters, fresh orange and Prosecco, It was slightly bitter but by the end had opened up my taste buds and was delicious! My girlfriend opted for an early evening cocktail option called My Pear Lady, made with Bombay Sapphire Gin, fresh pear, rosemary, lemon and soda. She loved it!To begin, I HAD to have a Ramsay Scallop appetizer. I mean after watching season after season of his shows and the scallop being the most elusive dish to do well, I knew I needed to have it. I was presented with 3 meaty scallops beautifully plated, and perfectly cooked. My girlfriend had a mushroom flatbread. Both were amazing and had us making audible sounds of enjoyment.Following our cocktails, we spoke with the sommelier, and discussed with him what we were having for our appetizers and mains and he made some recommendations for us to consider. We settled on a well priced medium bodied Spanish red called Pasión de Bobal. It was so amazing I could have drank a bottle to myself.Following the appetizer course and enjoying a glass of wine (or two) from our bottle our mains arrived promptly, The decision on mains was torture for me, I knew I could only pick one and I likely wouldn't be able to come back here for a long time again. After some tears I decided to go for the lamb entree which came with a polenta mash and a roasted tomato. I added a side of green beans done with parmigianno. From first bite to last I was in heaven, easily some of the best lamb I've ever had, like ever! I'm not a huge polenta fan but if someone made it like this for me everyday I would have no issue eating this. Finished with those beans! Oh those beans! Such a simple dish but the perfect match for the dish!Shortly after the main course the dessert menu came around but we decided to politely decline so as to not be overly stuffed and so we could enjoy the rest of our wineA fantastic experience and one that I wish I could have regularly. Alas, there are no Gordon Ramsay restaurants on Canada's east coast, so to enjoy Gordon's fine fare I'll need to seek out some of his locations in the USA. Until then, I have fond memories and great pictures to remind me of my delicious experience on Heddon StreetEatcrest Out

photos.caption: Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Flatbread starter
Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Beautiful medium bodies Spanish red recommended by the sommelier
Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. My pear lady

mRuK5pjxmZKZxv5q2GoUtA.text: Like all Hordon Ramsay's restaurants, everything was delicious. The service was good. But nothing too impressive

nuTFIvFylyr4ee6hNLOSpA.text: I really enjoyed this restaurant and I would recommend it for the food, environment but not the service.It was a special occasion, the food was delicious (above expectations), drinks were great, hostess and management was friendly.The waiter was lackluster and couldn't be found when we wanted to order more drinks or water. He also didn't explain the food and when it was time for dessert, he encouraged us to get dessert ( though they brought us out two of something different for our joint birthdays)Even the runner seemed confused when she dropped it off. It made the night a little disappointing

yOziXuzQiZTTuySC08H5Xg.text: I rarely travel to this side of Regent street, but soGlad we came here for brunch as it was really delicious and surprisingly affordable! The menu is not your boring standard brunch menu but something a little more exciting and interesting like the crumpets with fresh honeycomb and cinnamon mascarpone and the sweet corn and green chilli fritters! Yum! Everything tastes fresh and delicious and you can see the chefs busy at work in the kitchen. The pastries are on point too, my croissant was extra light and fresh tasting and was just the right amount of warm and crispy. Add that to some delicious fresh juices and a wonderful coffee and you can't really go wrong with a visit for brincb

photos.caption: Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Slice of sweet corn and green chilli fritter with red pepper relish, avocado and creme fraiche - yum!!
Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. The ice cream bar!
Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. View from the upstairs window

rxoW0QrFFJKD0G3zWIYgnw.text: Eating at a Gordon Ramsay restaurant, my expectations were very high. In being one of the greatest chefs in the world, I was really looking forward to a nice lunch. It was very good. The Beef Wellington was cooked to perfection so it melted in your mouth along with many other staple flavors in the signature dish. The only problem was that there was too much puff pastry and was a little heavy. The real star of the day though, was the cod. It was full of flavor and every element of the dish worked together to make an amazing finish. Every bite left you hungry for more. For dessert, we got the sticky toffee pudding, a Gordon Ramsay classic. It was definitely one of the best things I had during my trip to the UK. We also got the make your own ice cream bar. There was everything to top the wide selection of flavors from Jelly Beans to marshmallows or merengue, we had it all! The lady serving my brother and I was super kind, helpful, and chatty, she was great! Overall, I thought the food was really good and the service was spot on.

BCCR9rnuwC25X8ZCCRiyRQ.text: I'm quite partial to watching Gordon Ramsay get all sweary on my telly, so I was definitely looking forward to my first experience of his food offerings at Heddon Street Kitchen, one of his multiple London eateries. Unfortunately my first choices of both starter and main had sold out - but there were still plenty more delicious options. For a starter, I chose the Spicy Tuna Tartare, wonton crisps and creme fraiche. It was a very unusual texture and not that spicy, still enjoyable but I much preferred the Tamarind Spiced Chicken Wings. Well-spiced with a sticky glaze and an impressive portion - these, I'd definitely have again.One thing I always appreciate, especially during the colder months, is a big ol' bowl of tasty mac'n'cheese. Heddon Street Kitchen's offering is very much up there with the very best of the best. Rich slow-braised beef cubes, ooze-y cheese and an almost-too-much portion size, perfect. We alsoended up ordering the caesar salad with boiled egg, pancetta and anchovies. A tad bit more adventurous than my normal caesar salad style, the dressing was lovely and rich. Overall, definitely worth the cashsplash - plus, they do 2for1 details on the regs so even if you're on a budget, you don't have to miss out!

photos.caption: Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

YtMScpknsZe8i9ddd4xhTA.text: The beef Wellington melted in my mouth and went perfect with the house wine.  I tasted the lamb and beef cheeks and they were all very tasty.  Thumbs up!

photos.caption: Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

7GSnXyAcdrjo3t9K5ZurRg.text: As expected, the service was warm, professional and knowledgeable. Our waitress organised swift delivery of food and did so without making us feel rushed.The restaurant has a menu that wanders breezily around the world. Such as California roll, potato pie, pasta, ribs and a whole section titled "Grill". For dinner, I had kale salad and tuna tartare. It was well sourced and beautifully made. The tuna was fresh and firm, with a splendid chilli kick. But, too costly for starters & proportions were small. Overall, the staff were excellent, and the surroundings was welcoming. Some dishes are memorable but, for these prices, I expected more. Would I go back? Probably not.

photos.caption: Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Delicious, healthy salad for the night

d_pZUvhRP7nkx-P1C9n9Lw.text: This is a great restaurant with lovely decor and an open kitchen. Lots of sofas and big metal tables. Ample tables to choose from.My friend and I went to celebrate Christmas so we ordered beef Wellington with truffle mash for 2.The meat was of excellent quality, cooked medium rare to medium as mentioned. Really delicious pastry, carved perfectly. I would say it's not the best thing for a wooden board due to all the juices. Nevertheless the flavours were fabulous and we were very pleased. The truffle mash was excellent if very small in portion. The spinach was large leaf spinach and the onion rings were large and very crispy. Extra jus came in a side jug which was delicious too.Service was excellent, chatty, friendly, they knew the details of my reservation and offered to put our Wellington on straight away as it would take a long time. Would recommend and go back any time!!

0kOz3awnJLMib4khDRYRzw.text: It was a go big or go home moment for my very first Beef Wellington. I mean, if you've made it to 36 years old and never had a proper welly, it's got to be Gordon's classic dish or bust, right? My husband made reservations at Heddon Street for a late Saturday night dinner about a week before our long weekend in London. Night of, our table was ready when we arrived a few minutes early. We were promptly visited by a sommelier, who shortly thereafter delivered a beautiful Syrah. We enjoyed chatting with her the rest of the night as she checked in on us often to refill our glasses and ensure we were enjoying everything, including the wine. We couldn't decide on just one or two apps, so as is our MO, we over-ordered and got three. The turmeric chicken wings were my favorite of the three! So flavorful and crispy. The sauce was sticky and had the perfect sweet/savory balance I love so much. However the 'nduja filled gnocchi were a close, close second. The poor chips with truffle aioli would have been the star app anywhere else (they were quite tasty) but they paled in comparison to the wings and gnocchi. About 45-minutes after we placed the order (it takes some extra time for the wellington), the masterpiece arrived! Perfectly cooked, perfectly seasoned. My mouth started watering the minute they put it down in front of us. Everything about the dish was just perfect. From the tender, salty beef to the warm, flaky pastry crust... Even the accoutrements were mind blowing. I mean, can we talk about the truffle mashed potatoes for a minute? How do they even make a bowl of potatoes taste so rich and earthy yet light and airy all at the same time?!? Sadly, after all of that food, we were way too full for dessert. Next time we visit (oh, there will be a next time!) we will skip an app or two and go for the sticky toffee pudding. Thank you Gordon Ramsay and team for such a wonderful night out and a life-changing first taste of Beef Wellington!

photos.caption: Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. 'Nduja filled gnocchi
Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Beef Wellington FTW!!

RWTf3BV6TdsfwTdzQowCRg.text: Overall: 3/5. Food was fine, ambiance was great, but the experience was disappointing. Perhaps expectations were too high because of the Gordon Ramsey brand.Beef Wellington: 4/5 (amazing truffle mashed potatoes).Macaroni cheese: 3/5.Burrata, tomatoes, crostini: 3/5.Caesar salad: 2.5/5.Ambiance: 5/5. Trendy, hip decor with lively atmosphere.

fAo5WMPQtMAJpXKjRrWV6A.text: Very accessible walk from Piccadilly Circus tube stop, secluded in a quiet walking street, is Heddon Street Kitchen. Earlier in the day, I saw Gordon Ramsay post a brunch item, so thought this would be a great new spot to try for dinner. We were not disappointed!! Very friendly staff, chefs, made for a great night. Ordered my first ever Beef Wellington, and I enjoyed every bite! From the first taste to the last, it was very enjoyable. A friend ordered the duck, and he enjoyed it just the same. A cheeseburger was ordered for the younger guest, by the time I looked down to check it out, it was devoured. Wine selections complimented our meals, and the dessert bar upstairs was fantastic.Thank you to Ian (our waiter) and Dario (Head Chef) for a night I'll talk about for a long time! Only thing that would've made this visit better was to have had Gordon Ramsay walk in (but he didn't)

photos.caption: Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

GRZ0aS-KVM8thzzbIlUYJQ.text: What a treat!  We loved the experience here at Heddon Street.  And it is just that, an experience.  We of course we're attracted to this place due to the Gordon Ramsey fame, but unlike some other celeb spots we had been to in the past, this one did not disappoint.  We had the most original and well executed food we have had since leaving the states.  Italy has incredible food but calling it traditional may be the understatement of the year.  We had nduja gnocchi that was lightly fried.  They were little puffs of magic, I could have eaten a million of them.  Perfectly balanced and not too spicy, nduja can overpower a dish but not here.  The highlight of the visit was most likely the French sommelier that helped us choose a phenomenal red wine and checked back with us often to see how we liked it.  We also had the beef Wellington for two, it was what dreams are made of.  Perfectly cooked and so decadent and richly flavored.  The seasoning was spot on!  This place, what a place, I can't wait to go back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Wellington!

_fg9l_HTR1DKRBIjBakYWQ.text: Whilst in London in April 2017, I made dinner reservations at Gordon Ramsay's Heddon Street Kitchen. My sole purpose was to finally try Gordon's infamous Beef Wellington and I must say, it was quite impressive. The presentation alone was an art piece and the cook of the meat as well as the outer crust was perfect. It's presented on wood cutting board and is served with a pinch of Sea salt, a bed of fresh greens and a cluster of tomatoes still on the vine. The Beef Wellington comes with a side of Brie mashed potatoes and a red wine jus. The dish takes about 45 minutes from ordering, so sit back and enjoy a nice glass of wine or a cocktail and relax. The dish is recommended for two people and they charge 40 pounds per person. The ambience is casual while maintaining an upscale appeal. Although it's not one of his three Michelin starred restaurants, it allows a Gordon Ramsay experience without breaking the bank. If you are visiting London, I highly recommend having dinner here and experiencing the Beef Wellington.

photos.caption: Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Gordon Ramsay's Beef Wellington for two.

IukxdtDwLdnTJjhWFX8vww.text: First off, I ADORE that f% donky Ramsey! I Adore his show, adore the look of the restaurant and just PLAIN adore gazing at him. That being said I was disappointed in the food at Heddon Street. I suppose if I wasn't spending the £ that I did I wouldn't be so upset. I actually can't remember the name of what I had, the pigs stomach that was deeply fried/crusted. I ate the crust which was delish and dessert saved me. The pros are, the restaurant and downtown area were primo! Absolutely cool 2 floor restaurant with outside patio seating and lil lap blankets for those cool nights. The staircase going to the upstairs seating is beautiful. The loo is quite nice too and I found a new brand of soap & lotion that I've since ordered online, Au Lait by The Scottish Fine Soaps Company. The waitress was very nice and it being 17 friends out for dinner AND it being a Friday night, the staff handled themselves all very well. I will say that my joy in going to a Ramsey restaurant far outweighed my disappointment in the food. I think I'm just not so into the more glamorous foods ‍

mahU9pFizRfAjkUuWqVKBw.text: late review: still thinking about it a year later. By far one of the best meals I've ever had. Cooked perfectly and flavored by an angel.  I hope I have the opportunity to return. Also love Gordon Ramsay so this was a win all around!

photos.caption: Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. A masterpiece

cz8sZg-s7cpLvllek7Nz-g.text: My family and I went to Heddon Street Kitchen for dinner tonight.  We ordered two beef Wellington steaks to share.  This was 160 pounds as expected.  We also got olives and bread.  At the end of the meal the kids ordered ice cream, I ordered ice cream and my wife ordered the cream brulee.  The food was great, the service was OK, but right at the end of the night they screwed up the bill taking what would have been a great experience and making it a frustrating one. - First they charged us for the olives twice  when they shouldn't have.(they took it off when we asked)- They charged us for the kids ice cream even though they have a sign that kids eat free.  - They charged us the adult price for the kids ice cream 6 pounds instead of 4 pounds. When we asked why we weren't getting the kids price they said "because you didn't get a free kids meal".  So if I ordered those free meals and just left them on the table untouched we could have gotten the ice cream for the kids price?!This is NOT the type of service we would expect from a Gordon Ramsey Restaurant.  We bought the most expensive dish on the menu, wine, desserts, appetizers...I don't expect to be argued about 2 pounds when I'm spending 240 pounds for dinner.  Put a dark cloud over the night.

uqNpuKLiqmbij0Lc4ry9tw.text: Gordon Ramsey is one of my favorite chefs to watch and it was the perfect place to have a ladies night.  The set menu looked good and definitely worth trying out.   However, when we got there, we got sidetracked because the dishes on the main menu was so enticing.  We ended up ordering from the main menu and cocktails at 10 pounds each.I ordered the braised lamb GBP25.00 and I hate to say it was good but it did not leave an impression.  The confit duck leg was good $21.00 and the apple crumble $7.50 was good but better if it was served hot and with ice cream or even fresh cream.  When the bill came, it was a whopping GBP175 for 3 ppl. Turns out they charged us for water and the waitress bought out extra wings when we said we did not want it.  Of course we told the staff and they quickly rectified the bill.Overall, a nice fancy restaurant with a bar bistro feel to it. Very pricey when you don't order from the set menu.  Will try other Gordon Ramsey establishments instead of returning here.

syDSf7tzJpybe8iINuN6Kg.text: Having watched Gordon Ramsay for years, and after visiting Hell's Kitchen in Las Vegas (and loving it), I was excited to visit his Heddon St. Kitchen in London recently.  We were seated outside and ordered from the Thank Gord it's Summer set-menu. Our table had a small sofa on one side with chairs on the other.  Unfortunately the sofa had not been cleaned in the recent past and was covered in crumbs and other unidentifiable substances. Our table was also off-centre and wobbly. This was not rectified until we got up to exchange the table ourselves, as our waiter appeared disinterested in us. This was such a glaring difference from our experience at Hell's Kitchen, where our every need was anticipated - while relatively pleasant, or waiter did the bare minimum and answered our questions with 2-3 words, not offering recommendations or other information.  We had to flag someone down whenever we needed anything and even got up to get the water jug ourselves. The manager checked in with us early on when things were still OK, but we had to get up and go to him towards the end of our meal to express our concerns. Food wise, we all had the wing starter, which was tasty, but mine still had some feathers on them. I subsequently sent them back, and they were replaced with feather-free ones, but I got no explanation. The burgers were very good and cooked to our liking, but mine had a gluten free bun that had been over-microwaved, and was hard in spots (I thought GR didn't use microwaves)...I didn't bother to send it back, however, as we had been there for over an hour at this point. We added a couple servings of chips for the table and while they were cooked well and could have been a highlight, they were unseasoned and bland. We all tried different desserts, with the chocolate mousse and pineapple carpaccio getting high marks. I asked for the sticky toffee pudding, which tasted delicious, but again was microwaved - and crunchy in spots. The manager was receptive to our feedback and discounted our meal, but I left feeling disappointed in my London GR experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

7ZHBHmU2_FKIbVN8bsiM0w.text: Amazing! Gordon Ramsay has done it again! The filet here is the best I've had, and don't even get me started on the buttery mashed potatoes! Those potatoes are better than anything(even sex haha)! The food was so flavorful, and it was definitely worth the money. The service was extremely courteous, and I love the patio area where I can watch Londoners bustle around Piccadilly Circus. Heddon Street Kitchen is a must see!

photos.caption: Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. The filet and heavenly mashed potatoes! A must have!

z91uAxUGNELV97zrgzGh2Q.text: Had a couple of business associates visiting london and needed to suddenly take them out for dinner to - a "nice" place - in the centre of town- that wasn't too fussy about dress code as we were meeting after work, - would take a Friday evening booking for 4 on Friday morning. Heddon street kitchen seemed to fit the bill. After years of watching Gordon Ramsay bully and berate chefs, aspiring chefs, restaurant owners and hotel owners on television, I must admit I was curious as to what to expect in one of his own kitchens.I'm not a fan of his onscreen personality (except his series when he was travelling across Asia), but I must admit that his kitchen (at this location) is well run.We ordered mostly seafood as my companions were pescatarians. The scallops and vegetarian flat bread were lovely. I'm not a fan of haddock, so I wasn't too thrilled with the asparagus and haddock, but they enjoyed it. Cod and halibut were ordered for mains, while I had a carpaccio of roast beef (first time I'm having a cooked beef carpaccio), it was lightly cooked, still red in the centre, and mostly meat. (I'm used to a lot of salad leaves with my carpaccio) But very delicious.The triple cooked fries were nice and crispy, but even I who eat very low salt food, felt they needed more salt. However, since we were busy talking we forgot to even ask for some ketchup to eat them with and they turned cold and got left on the table. We did however finish everything else that was served. We tried the sticky toffee pudding, crime brûlée and chocolate fondant for dessert and I have to give top marks to all of them.It's a great place to take guests out for a meal, with enough variety on the menu to suit multiple dietary requirements and very comfortable and scenic seating (we sat upstairs and had a very picturesque view of the street outside)

photos.caption: Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

CUR0S524-Ml5939gmOxfMw.text: It was meh.... we're BIG Ramsey fans and we were expecting a bit.. well.. more I guess. For the price tag, not worth it. The appetizers where very good. The desserts were spectacular. But the main dishes, all of them, were mediocre. Even the Beef WELLINGTON which was supposed to be outstanding.  Bummer. Id skip it and find a better Ramsey restaurant

photos.caption: Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Creme brule.
Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

Z0nXqPJ6Re4DsqEb1qlrRA.text: Get the Beef Wellington!!!! End of story. Haha okay I'll give you a little more to work with. So my family and I visited London and we are huge Gordon Ramsey fans so I went on a hunt trying to find which of his restaurants has good reviews as well as somewhat affordable pricing. This place caught my eye considering there were several main entrees for under 20 pounds. So I made a reservation for 4 in Open Table. We ordered the beef Wellington, which requires two people and costs 37.50 pounds per person. We also ordered the burger and the chicken. Everything was delicious. The chicken was moist and a huge serving. The burger was juicy and came with perfectly cooked French fries. The star of course was the beef Wellington. The beef was so tender and flavorful, surrounded with the delicious pastry. It came with this truffle mash potato that was addicting. My brother is a huge steak lover and this is by far the best he's ever had. My only complaint is that they charge for water. Really guys?!?

photos.caption: Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Burger and fries
Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Nice portion of chicken
Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. Beef Wellington. The best!

G-gD_OU6MrS4SfA8RzQfsg.text: This place was really good. I love Gordon Ramsay and have always wanted to dine at one of his restaurants, so the experience was great just because of that. In addition, the service was pretty fast, and the waiters were very nice. I had the duck confit, and it was really good. The portion sizes are not the best, but that's kind of what I expected for a place of this caliber. I enjoyed this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom

QGQFDxpgYO3z-zMiMWGoxA.text: I was quite excited about this Gordon Ramsay institution, and overall it was good. The restaurant was dimly lit, a nice homey, rustic, wooden interior. The service was good as well. - Beef wellington - I was quite excited to have this but I found it quite heavy and extremely salty. The layer of puff pastry was quite thick, almost a pie crust, the mushroom duxelle lacked consistency, the beef was perfectly mid-rare, but because of the density of the dish, just weighed everything down.- Truffle mashed potatoes - This comes with the beef wellington. Deliciously creamy, truffle flavor permeating throughout, perfect mashed potatoes. Probably my favorite dish. - Kale salad - I'm so glad we got this, it helped freshen the heaviness of the wellington. - Sticky toffee pudding - Probably my favorite English dessert. Perfectly warm date cake and sweet, sticky, creamy topping. So good.Overall, I was a bit underwhelmed by the beef wellington, which I was so excited about, but still a decent place to go!

y0QV_LX7tiSRUjD2cJxC9A.text: For a GR establishment, I was kind of underwhelmed. I've been to a few of his restaurants and this is the first one that let me down. Service: was ok. Biggest gripe was that I didn't even know who my server was because we had at least 5 different people come and take orders/check in on us. Food: here's where I was let down. Got the gnocchi and flatbread to start and they were pretty solid. For a main we did the Wellington for 2 and it was just bland. The cook was fine but it desperately needed to be seasoned. The pastry was falling off of the meat (I suspect because it is sliced into 6 pieces) and the filling was uneven. I have loved the Wellington in the past but this one was just not good and made me regret my decision. Toffee pudding for dessert was great. Ambiance: nice and pretty chic (but also casual). Music was kind of bad but not much to do about that. Overall, it was ok. There were some hits and misses with the meal, but for the total price I was REALLY disappointed.

Cu2Amo9Ry9yQfoyJtVnAMQ.text: Being a fan of Gordon Ramsay, I went to Heddon when I was in London. Right when we arrived, we received a friendly greeting and was seated promptly.For the food, I shared the beef Wellington with my GF. The beef was tender and cooked to perfection. The crust was also flaky and crunchy. The accompanying mashed potato was out of this world! My overall dining experience was amazing! Would come again the next time I am in London.

92NNmS8d3hS3852G9mGVgQ.text: Our Gordon Ramsey obsession brought my husband and I to Heddon Street while visiting London this week and we were not disappointed.We dined late and we're lucky to get in without a reservation. The ambiance is relaxed but upscale and Impressive, we immediately knew we were in the right place. We split everything and went with the salt and pepper squid, njuda gnocchi, scallops, tortoloni, jersey potatoes, and sticky toffee pudding. Everything we ate was perfectly executed and up to the standards I would expect from an establishment baring the Ramsey name. I have a bit of a buratta obsession and fell in love with the buratta stuffed tortoloni, it was a to die for flavor combination that's not to be missed while visiting Heddon Street. The sticky toffee pudding was also unbelievable, by far one of the best desserts I've had in ages. Don't let them fool you with the Jersey potatoes and their "unique" presentation, they are delicious but simple roasted potatoes.Finally, service was all over the map. We had three servers throughout the evening. One was outstanding and the other two were fine. Despite that we loved Heddon Street and are glad it was our first introduction to Ramsey's restaurants.

AAemCI0La4NgwY-1G6uyxQ.text: Not sure what I expected but it was still a very nice night. We are big foodies and we had already eaten at another venue so my husband only wanted a dessert dish. I'm of course a huge slob so I got a starter and a small meal as well. I didn't like the questions about just having a dessert dish tho. Who cares what you eat!  I did enjoy the tuna tartar, in fact one of the best I've had anywhere.The venue is very nice.Also, minus on the dirty martinis. Small and zero dirty. Do they know how to make them outside of the US? Anyway, worth visiting :)

photos.caption: Photo of Heddon Street Kitchen - London, United Kingdom. The restaurant has a lovely ambiance.
